CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. 36, reads: "NAACP Radiothon - Dedicated to obtaining democracy in fact in this country, the local chapter of the NAACP and Radio Station WAMO last Saturday held a radiothon to appeal to the populace to enlist in fight for freedom by taking out NAACP memberships. In the left photo, WAMO announcers Sir Walter and Bill Powell happily interview Miss Margaret Smith and her brother, Lewis, who, after hearing the appeal, decided to personally bring their memberships to Radiothon headquarters in the Centre Avenue YMCA... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: WAMO Radio Station disc jockeys John "Sir Walter" Christian and Rev. Bill Powell wearing sunglasses, interviewing Margaret Smith and her brother Lewis Smith, for NAACP Radiothon membership drive, Centre Avenue YMCA
CatSubject_tab: Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.WAMO (Pittsburgh, Pa).Radio broadcasters--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Microphone--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Sunglasses--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
